sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The blessed peace-maker and Christian reconciler: intended for the healing of all unatural and unchristian divisions, in all relations: according to the purport of that divine oracle, pronounced by the Prince of Peace himself, Matth. 5.9. By Claudius Gilbert, B.D. minister of the Gospel at Limrick. Gilbert, Claudius, d. 1696?
[24], 131, [1] p.
printed for Francis Titon, and are to be sold at the sign of the three Daggers in Fleet-street, London : 1658.
Running title reads: The blessed peace-maker. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aprill". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

printed for Francis Titon, and are to be sold at the sign of the three Daggers in Fleet-street, London : 1658.
Running title reads: The blessed peace-maker. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aprill". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

the sign of the three Daggers in Fleet-street
